name: Michael Bracey
about: I'm a front-end software developer with a passion for pixel art! Here you can look at my latest projects.

highlights: Developed and maintained WebGL casino games such as slot machines and scratch cards in a Agile team utilising Jira kanban boards
Conducted research on building games with Unity and C#.
Obtained a distinction grade in my Level 4 Software Developer Apprenticeship.
Designed and developed mobile-first microsites for clients to advertise job vacancies with Hays' CMS.
Worked as part of an international team to build salary guide sites for different European regions such as France, Portugal, Poland, etc.
Maintained and fixed existing microsites, while making sure they still work on different browsers and devices using BrowserStack.

projects.name: Last Castle Game
projects.summary: A free tower defence game made in the Godot engine. Developement started in December 2024, and it currently has over 800 browser plays.

projects.name: A Plinko Prototype
projects.summary: My final project for my apprenticeship was built with Unity and C# within 2 months. This was followed by a 4,000 word essay and an interview where I discussed my work with an assessor.

education.name: Software Developer Apprenticeship with Multiverse
education.summary: Achieved a Distinction in my Software Engineering Level 4 Qualification.

education.name: IT Career Switch
education.summary: A 6 month coding traineeship to develop the skills needed to become a full stack developer.

education.name: Introduction to Programming with Python Short Course
education.summary: Enrolled with University of London for a month of online lectures and coding exercises to learn about programming with Python.

education.name: Richard Challoner School
education.summary: Finished secondary school with A Levels in Physics, Maths and Geography, and 10 GCSEs.
